instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Something I noticed with newer OS - unable to restart after liquid damage repair.
threads.message:
The last few repairs I had this occurrence across different models (MacBook Air, Retina, and IIRC a third older one with built-in DVD), following liquid damage repair. 
Once I have fan spin and mount the board back in the housing, I notice the OS loads Â¾ then drops and turns off. 
In all 3 cases I connected via target mode, repaired the directory using Disk Warrior, and they started acting normally and have had no returns. 
Anyone notice anything similar?

threads.title: Something I noticed with newer OS - unable to restart after liquid damage repair.
threads.message: Corrupt OSX is nothing special. I use Disk Warrior all the time for this.

threads.title: Something I noticed with newer OS - unable to restart after liquid damage repair.
threads.message:
Thanks. Oh and not saying it is special. We see it a lot with iOS devices under similar conditions.
But saying I did not use to encounter it so much before when repairing Macs with older OS'.
